PageTitle: stp binding process to link-share (Layer 2 interface view)
FuncDef:
The stp binding process to link-share command configures an interface to participate in the status calculation of multiple Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) processes.
The undo stp binding process to command configures an interface to quit the status calculation of an MSTP process. The stp binding process to link-share command configures an interface to participate in the status calculation of multiple Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) processes. The undo stp binding process to command configures an interface to quit the status calculation of an MSTP process. By default, an MSTP interface participates in status calculation only in MSTP process 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the start MSTP process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

Specifies the ID of the end MSTP process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

ExtraInfo: On a Layer 2 network running MSTP, the link used by multiple access rings is a public link. An interface on the public link participates in the spanning tree calculation for multiple MSTP processes and access rings. Each MSTP process calculates an interface status. As a result, the interface may have multiple status, and which status is used cannot be determined. To prevent this problem, run the stp binding process link-share command to add the interface to multiple MSTP processes. The interface always uses its status in MSTP process 0, although it participates in status calculation in multiple MSTP processes.
